channel.title: Locked out of windows 7
channel.description: I went on my laptop, talked to someone on skype for a little bit, got off, brought it upstairs (closed it) so I had to login again, this time it wouldn't let me. It kept saying my password was wrong, which it wasn't, and now I can't get in at all. I looked on google and theres all different answers but none seems to fit mine. I don't have any other accounts, so I can't do guest and shit. My boot options are pretty limited and I'm fucking pissed. I don't know why this is acting the fuck up. Need advice, quickly.

item.title: Locked out of windows 7
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

You could attempt to crack your SAM files, but I don’t think that will help as the problem seems to be something with Windows rather then with the password being changed/forgotten

If you still haven’t gotten it or read anything on a fix, I would probably make a backup of my entire hard drive and just reinstall Windows

That’s just me though good luck again

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out of windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I have a friend who has this as well. I suppose there’s nothing to it but reinstall windows?

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out of windows 7
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

He didn’t forget it, I’ve heard of people having this problem before as well. I’ve never had the problem so I don’t know how to fix it.

Is it possible to boot into safe mode and access the original administrator account on 7?

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out of windows 7
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you forgot your password, maybe you can brute-force it with this:
http://ophcrack.sourceforge.net/

I know it works on XP, not sure about 7.

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out of windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:4, topic:415482”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=517431.msg3758763#msg3758763 date=1316709396]

Try this when logging in:

In place of username use: computername\username

Same password as you used before the problem started.

Basically your saying to log in, which is what I can’t do?
[/quote]

I’m saying instead of logging in like you normally would (ie: username -> password) you should use computername/username -> password. Where ‘computername’ is the name you gave to your computer (ie: alex-pc).[/quote]
My computer just has the switch thing, you can’t enter a username.

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out of windows 7
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:3, topic:415482”][quote author=Newty link=topic=517431.msg3758508#msg3758508 date=1316666985]
Try this when logging in:

In place of username use: computername\username

Same password as you used before the problem started.
[/quote]
Basically your saying to log in, which is what I can’t do?[/quote]

I’m saying instead of logging in like you normally would (ie: username -> password) you should use computername/username -> password. Where ‘computername’ is the name you gave to your computer (ie: alex-pc).

Read full topic
